intro: Talisia panamensis, commonly known as the Panama talisia, is a tropical shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
